Type.Name: TreeModelSort

TypeSignature.Value: public class TreeModelSort : GLib.Object, Gtk.TreeDragSource, Gtk.TreeModel, Gtk.TreeSortable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A class that makes an underlying sortable.
Returns the number of children the object's iterator has.
Docs.remarks: As a special case, if iter is , then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

Docs.summary: Returns the rows of this tree.
Docs.param: A to fill with the rows of this tree.
Docs.returns: A , true if this tree has children, false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: The underlying C call supports the specification of arbitrary parent rows to return children of, but the C# bindings assume that the root node is always the parent.

Docs.summary: Fires a event.
Docs.remarks: Designed to be called by routines that change the sort of the tree.

MemberSignature.Value: public void EmitRowHasChildToggled (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the event.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models after the child state of a node changes.

Docs.summary: Gets the of .
Returns if iter has children, otherwise.
Lets the tree ref the node.

remarks.para: This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons.

This function is primarily meant as a way for views to let caching models know when nodes are being displayed (and hence, whether or not to cache that node.) For example, a file-system based model would not want to keep the entire file-hierarchy in memory, just the sections that are currently being displayed by every current view.
A model should be expected to be able to get an iter independent of its referenced state.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of children that has.
Docs.remarks: As a special case, if is , then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public void EmitRowInserted (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the event.
Docs.param: an object of type , path of the inserted row.
an object of type , points to the inserted row.

Docs.summary: Emits the event.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models after a row has been removed. The location pointed to by should be the location that the row previously was at. It may not be a valid location anymore.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetValist (Gtk.TreeIter iter, IntPtr var_args);

Docs.summary: Gets the values of child properties for the row pointed to by .
Docs.param: a , pointer to the va_list data structure of arguments (FIXME: clarify what va_lists look like)

Docs.summary: Lets the tree unref the node.
Docs.remarks: This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons. For more information on what this means, see . Please note that nodes that are deleted are not unreferenced.

Docs.summary: Converts to a path on the child model of this TreeModelSort object. (In other words, points to a location within this objectable.)
Docs.returns: A new that points to the same location as in the model that's not sorted. May also return if the does not point to a location in the child model.

Docs.summary: * This function should almost never be called. It clears the TreeModelSort object of any cached iterators that haven't been reffed with . This might be useful if the child model being sorted is static (and doesn't change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iters will be invalid.
Clear the default sort function.

Converts to a path relative to . That is, points to a path in the child model. The returned path will point to the same row in the sorted model. If isn't a valid path on the child model, then is returned.
Internal constructor

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: Constructor.
Docs.param: A , the child model for the new object.
Docs.remarks: FIXME: needs more explanation.

Docs.summary: The number of columns supported by the object.
Docs.value: An integer count of the columns.

Docs.summary: Returns a set of flags supported by this interface. The flags are a bitwise combination of .
Docs.remarks: The flags supported should not change during the lifecycle of the tree model.

Docs.summary: Raised when the sort column is changed.
Raised when the child state of a row is toggled.
Raised when a new row is inserted into the tree.
Raised when a row is deleted from the tree.
Raised when a tree row is changed.
Raised when rows are reordered or moved around.

Docs.remarks: In this case, the nth root node is set.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterNthChild (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the child of , using the given index.
Docs.remarks: The first index is 0. If is too big, or has no children, is set to an invalid iterator and is returned. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

Docs.summary: Sets to point to the first child of .
Docs.remarks: If has no children, is returned and is set to be invalid. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

Docs.summary: Sets to a valid iterator pointing to .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterParent (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter child);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the parent of .
Docs.remarks: If is at the toplevel, and does not have a parent, then is set to an invalid iterator and is returned. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

Docs.summary: Generates a string representation of the path of .
Docs.remarks: This string is a ':' separated list of numbers. For example, "4:10:0:3" would be an acceptable return value for this string.

Docs.summary: Tests whether is a valid iterator for this TreeModel.

Docs.summary: This method asks the source row for the dragged data to delete itself, because that data has been moved elsewhere.
Docs.param: a , the path of the row that was dragged
Docs.remarks: This method returns FALSE if the deletion fails because path no longer exists, or for some other model-specific reason.

Docs.summary: Checks to see whether a given row can be used as a source for a drag-and-drop operation.
Docs.returns: a , TRUE if the row is draggable.
Docs.remarks: If the object does not implement this method, the row is assumed to be draggable.
